elements.name: LandingHeading
elements.html: LP/GOLPP Survey 2026

elements.name: LandingText
elements.html:
The goal of this survey is to collect information about your beloved animal companion's experience with the disease of laryngeal paralysis (LP) or Geriatric-Onset Laryngeal Paralysis and Polyneuropathy (GOLPP).

We know how hard it is to lose one's beloved companion. If your companion has recently crossed over the Rainbow Bridge, maybe it's best to do the survey later when you've had time to heal.

elements.name: LandingJourneyHeading
elements.html: Your LP/GOLPP Journey

elements.name: LandingJourneyText
elements.html: The LP/GOLPP journey is a learning process, and at the beginning people often have more questions than answers. The survey asks you to remember details about your LP/GOLPP journey. If you find yourself answering 'Don't know' to many of the questions, it's best to discontinue the survey and return later when you have more information.

elements.name: LandingAboutPrivacyHeading
elements.html: About your privacy and personal information

elements.name: LandingAboutPrivacyText01
elements.html: We're not asking for your last name, so we have no way to connect you with any of your private data. We need only four pieces of information to verify survey results:

elements.name: LandingAboutPrivacyText02
elements.html:
• Your first name
  • Your companion animal's name
  • The country in which you live
  • Your email address or Facebook account name

elements.name: LandingAboutPrivacyText02
elements.html: With this info, we can ensure that all the survey respondents are unique and verifiable without having to collect any information that makes you identifiable outside the context of the survey. For details about how we'll use the data we collect and further steps we'll take to anonymize your contact information, select the 'About your privacy' and 'Consent information' links.

elements.name: LandingPrivacy
elements.html: About your privacy

elements.name: LandingData
elements.html: How will we be using your information?

elements.name: LandingConsentHeading
elements.html: By clicking the checkbox below, you confirm that you're ready to answer questions about your LP companion and consent to the terms of our privacy and consent statements.

elements.name: LandingConsent
elements.title: Do you agree to the terms and conditions?

elements.name: UserInfoHeading
elements.html: About You

elements.name: UserInfoText
elements.html: We're asking for your first name, which country you live in, and some optional demographics to help us understand the people who are making choices for their beloved LP companions. We also ask for contact info to prevent fake respondents and make sure each respondent is unique and verifiable.

elements.name: UserInfoVerificationHeading
elements.html: Verification Contact

elements.name: UserInfoVerificationPanelText
elements.html:
We contact a random sample of respondents for verification purposes. You may or may not be contacted. You can provide an email address or, if you're more comfortable communicating via Facebook Messenger, you can provide your Facebook account name.

With your consent, we may also contact you to talk in more detail about your experience with LP.

elements.name: UserInfoContactType
elements.title: Would you like to use email or Facebook Messenger for verification?
Email address:
elements.name: UserInfoContactTypeEmail
UserInfoContactTypeFacebookInstructions
elements.title: z
elements.html: Please go to your Facebook account page and copy the URL, then paste it below. Example: https://facebook.com/my.user.name.

elements.title: Facebook account:
elements.name: UserInfoContactTypeFacebook

validators.text: Please enter a valid Facebook profile URL, e.g., https://facebook.com/your.username

elements.name: UserInfoContactOK
elements.title: May we contact you to talk more about your LP experience?

elements.name: CmpnNameLifeStatusHeading
elements.html: Before We Begin

elements.name: CmpnNameLifeStatusText
elements.html:
We know how hard it is to lose one's beloved companion animal. If you're still grieving from the loss, maybe it's best to do the survey later when you've had time to heal.

If you'd like to continue now, now please tell us your LP companion's name and if they have crossed over the Rainbow Bridge. This will help us avoid questions that are inappropriate for your situation.

elements.name: CmpnName
elements.title: Please tell us your companion's name:

elements.name: LifeStatus
elements.title: Has your companion crossed over the Rainbow Bridge?

elements.name: InfoSourcesHeading
elements.html: How did you learn about LP/GOLPP?

elements.name: InfoSourcesText
elements.html: This section asks some questions about how you learned about laryngeal paralysis and geriatric-onset laryngeal paralysis (LP) and polyneuropathy (GOLPP) and whether the information you found helped you make decisions for {CmpnName}. There is no right or wrong answer, so please answer as best as you can without thinking too hard about it.

elements.name: InfoSourcesPriorKnowledge
elements.title: Had you ever heard of LP before {CmpnName} got it?

elements.name: InfoSourcesTypes
elements.title: Which sources of information have you accessed to learn about LP?

choices.text: Reddit, X (Twitter), or other social media

elements.name: InfoSourcesBestSource
elements.title: Which of those information sources did you find MOST useful (please select one)?

elements.name: InfoSourcesHardToUnderstand
elements.title: Did you find the information you got about LP difficult to understand?
elements.description: 1 = no, not difficult at all, 5 = very difficult

elements.name: InfoSourcesContradictory
elements.title: Do you feel like a lot of the information you got about LP was contradictory?
elements.description: 1 = not at all contridictory, 5 = very contradictory

elements.name: InfoSourcesClearAnswers
elements.title: Did you find it hard to get clear answers to your questions so you could make informed choices for {CmpnName}?
elements.description: 1 = No, not hard at all, 5 = yes, very hard

elements.name: IntubationHistoryHeading
elements.html: Intubation History

elements.name: IntubationHistoryText
elements.html: This section asks about {CmpnName}'s intubation history in the 12 months prior to LP/GOLPP symptoms.

elements.name: IntubationHistoryWasIntubated
elements.title: Had {CmpnName} been intubated under anesthesia for any reason in the 12 months prior to the first LP symptoms?

elements.name: IntubationHistoryReason
elements.title: For what reason or reasons was {CmpnName} intubated prior to the first LP symptoms appearing?

elements.name: IntubationHistoryConcerns
elements.title: Do you remember having any concerns about how the intubation/anesthesia affected {CmpnName}?

elements.name: IntubationHistorySymptoms
elements.title: What symptoms did {CmpnName} have after the intubation/anesthesia?

elements.name: BreathingCrisis
elements.html: LP Breathing Crisis

elements.name: BreathingCrisisText
elements.html: In a breathing crisis, the paralyzed arytenoid cartilages block the airway and cut off airflow to the lungs. In extreme cases, the crisis escalates into a breathing emergency that requires care at a veterinary facility to restore breathing. These questions are about breathing emergencies that required care from a licensed veterinarian.

elements.name: BreathingCrisisDidHave
elements.title: Did {CmpnName} ever have a breathing crisis that required an emergency visit to a veterinary professional?

elements.name: BreathingCrisisCount
elements.title: How many times did {CmpnName} visit a veterinary professional due to an LP/GOLPP-associated breathing crisis?

elements.name: BreathingCrisisCost
elements.title: About what was the total pre-insurance cost of these visits to veterinary professionals due to LP/GOLPP-induced breathing crises/emergencies?

choices.text: Don't know or prefer not to say

elements.name: BreathingCrisisAdvice
elements.title: Did a veterinary professional give you any advice on how to deal with an LP-induced breathing emergency/crisis?

elements.name: BreathingCrisisAdviceType
elements.title: What advice did they give you to help you deal with a breathing crisis?

choices.text: Get them to a cool place
Apply ice, a cooling vest, or some other cooling agent
Bring them to an emergency facility immediately

elements.name: BreathingCrisisProvidedSubstance
elements.title: Did a veterinary professional provide you with a substance or product to help deal with an LP/GOLPP-induced breathing emergency/crisis?

elements.name: BreathingCrisisProvidedSubstanceType
elements.title: What substance or product did they provide?

elements.name: BreathingCrisisSubstanceForm
elements.title: In what form was the sedative or steriod provided?

elements.name: EarlySymptomsHeading
elements.html: Your early encounters with LP/GOLPP

elements.name: EarlySymptomsText
elements.html: Most people know something's wrong with their companion before they know it's LP or even before they know there is such a thing as LP. This section asks questions about the early phase of your LP/GOLPP journey and how you came to believe {CmpnName} might have it.

elements.name: EarlySymptomsFirstSignsPanel
elements.title: About how old was {CmpnName} (in years and months) when you first noticed signs of what you later learned was LP?

elements.name: EarlySymptomsAgeYears
elements.title: Years

elements.name: EarlySymptomsAgeMonths
elements.title: Months (number 1 - 12)

elements.name: symptomDurationDisplay
elements.html: {CmpnName} has had symptoms for {lengthOfSymptomsinMonths} months.

elements.name: EarlySymptomsType
elements.title: What symptoms did {CmpnName} have at that time?

elements.name: EarlySymtomsSeverity
elements.title: How severe did you think {CmpnName}'s early symptoms were?

elements.name: EarlySymptomsHindEndWeakness
elements.title: Was {CmpnName} already showing signs of hind-end weakness in this early stage?

elements.name: EarlyOtherConditions
elements.title: Which other conditions did {CmpnName} have when the first LP symptoms appeared?

elements.name: PrimaryDurationHeading
elements.html: Duration of care by primary veterinarians for LP/GOLPP symptoms

elements.name: PrimaryDurationText
elements.html: This section asks questions about the duration of {CmpnName}'s care by primary veterinarians for LP/GOLPP symptoms. This includes any primary veterinarians who saw {CmpnName} since the LP/GOLPP symptoms first appeared. It also asks whether you switched primary vets because of how {CmpnName}'s symptoms were being handled.

elements.name: PrimaryDurationFirstConsult
elements.title: About how old was {CmpnName} when you first consulted with a primary veterinarian about LP/GOLPP symptoms?

elements.name: PrimaryDurationFirstConsultYears
elements.title: Age in years (number):

elements.name: PrimaryDurationFirstConsultMonths
elements.title: Months (number 0 - 12)

elements.name: PrimaryDurationVisitsNumber
elements.title: About how many times did a primary veterinarian see {CmpnName} about LP/GOLPP symptoms?

elements.name: PrimaryDurationCost
elements.title: About what was the total pre-insurance cost of these visits to primary veterinarians about {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP symptoms?

choices.text: Don't know or prefer not to say

elements.name: PrimaryDurationChangedVets
elements.title: Did you ever change primary veterinarians because how they handled {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP symptoms?

elements.name: PrimaryDurationChangedVetsReason
elements.title: Why did you change veterinarians after {CmpnName} started showing symptoms of LP/GOLPP?

choices.text: The previous vet said nothing could be done about {CmpnName}'s symptoms.
The previous vet couldn't give possible causes for {CmpnName}'s symptoms.
The previous vet said {CmpnName}'s symptoms were just due to age.
The previous vet ordered tests that I didn't think were relevant to {CmpnName}'s symptoms.

elements.name: PrimaryVetHeading
elements.html: Your primary veterinarian and {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP

elements.name: PrimaryVetText
elements.html:
This section asks questions about your primary veterinarian's handling of {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP symptoms.

If you changed primary vets since {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP symptoms first appeared , please answer the question about your preferred or most recent primary veterinarian.

elements.name: PrimaryVetInflammation
elements.title: Did your primary veterinarian observe any inflammation, irritation, or infection in the larynx/pharynx area?

elements.name: PrimaryVetDiagnosis
elements.title: Did your primary vet discuss LP/GOLPP {CmpnName}'s as a possible cause of {CmpnName}'s symptoms?

choices.text: No, did not mention LP/GOLPP at all
Said {CmpnName}'s symptoms were possibly due to LP/GOLPP
Said {CmpnName}'s symptoms were definitely due to LP/GOLPP

elements.name: PrimaryRecommendInfoDidGive
elements.title: Did your current primary veterinarian give you helpful information about how LP/GOLPP might affect {CmpnName}?

elements.name: PrimaryRecommendInfoDetails
elements.title: What did they tell you about the how LP/GOLPP might affect {CmpnName}?

elements.name: PrimaryRecommendSurgery
elements.title: Did your primary veterinarian make a recommendation about tieback or other LP/GOLPP surgeries for {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP?

choices.text: Encouraged me to talk to a surgeon

elements.name: PrimaryRecommendSurgeryPerception
elements.title: Do you feel like your primary veterinarian's recommendation against surgery was due to {CmpnName}'s condition or to a generally negative perception of tieback surgery?

elements.name: PrimaryRecommendConfidence
elements.title: How confident have you been you in your current primary veterinarian's knowledge level regarding LP/GOLPP?
elements.description: 1 = not at all confident, 5 = very confident

elements.name: PrimaryRecommendCSatisfaction
elements.title: How satisfied have you been with your current primary veterinarian's handling of {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP?
elements.description: 1 = not at all satisfied, 5 = very satisfied

elements.name: DiagnosisHeading
elements.html: {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP diagnosis

elements.name: DiagnosisText
elements.html:
This section asks who provided {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP diagnosis and what diagnostic procedures they used to arrive at their conclusion.

You may have seen multiple vets about {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP symptoms. Please answer the question about the vet who provided the definitive diagnosis, i.e., the one you used to make decisions about {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP.

elements.name: DiagnosisWho
elements.title: Which veterinary professional provided you with the definitive LP/GOLPP diagnosis:

elements.name: PrimaryVetDiagnosticType
elements.title: What diagnostic procedure ws used to arrive at the definitive diagnosis?

choices.text: Video endoscope or laryngoscope under anesthesia

elements.name: DiagnosisCost
elements.title: What was the pre-insurance cost of the diagnosis?

choices.text: Don't know or prefer not to say

elements.name: DiagnosisSurgeonContingent
elements.title: Did the surgeon make the definitive diagnosis by laryngoscope or video endoscope contingent on proceeding with the LP surgery?

choices.text: Yes, required surgery consent before diagnosis
No, did not require surgery consent for diagnosis

elements.name: TreatmentStatusHeading
elements.html: Veterinary-Medical Procedures

elements.name: TreatmentStatusText
elements.html: This section asks if {CmpnName} underwent any veterinary-medical procedure such as surgery or stent implant for LP/GOLPP and if so, which procedure.

elements.name: TreatmentStatusText
elements.html: IMPORTANT: This only includes surgeries or procedures that act directly on the larynx. It doesn't include acupuncture, physical therapy or other therapies your vet may have prescribed.

elements.name: TreatmentStatusDidHave
elements.title: Did undergo {CmpnName} a veterinary-medical procedure such as surgery or a stent implant for LP/GOLPP?

elements.name: TreatmentStatusAgePanel
elements.title: About how old was {CmpnName} when she had the surgery or stent procedure?
elements.description: If you can't remember exactly, it's OK to guesstimate.

elements.name: TreatmentStatusAgeYears
elements.title: Age (years)

elements.name: TreatmentStatusAgeMonths
elements.title: Age (months)

elements.name: TreatmentFactorsHeading
elements.html: Factors that have influenced your LP/GOLPP decisions

elements.name: TreatmentFactorsText
elements.html: This sections asks what factors you considered when deciding what kind of treatment to pursue for {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP.

elements.name: TreatmentFactorsDecision
elements.title: Have you made a decision about whether or not to pursue LP surgery such as tieback for {CmpnName}?

choices.text: We will pursue LP surgery such as tieback.
We've decided not to pursue LP surgery.

elements.name: TreatmentFactorsDecisionStent
elements.title: If a veterinarian were to offer a stent implant for LP/GOLPP in your area, would you explore that as a surgery alternative?

choices.text: Yes, we would consider a stent implant.
No, we would not consider a stent implant.

elements.name: TreatmentFactorsDetailsText
elements.html: Please rate the relevant factors in your decision whether or not to pursue tieback or other LP/GOLPP surgery.

elements.name: TreatmentFactorsCost
elements.title: Cost of procedure:

elements.name: TreatmentFactorsCostComplications
elements.title: Cost of possible post-op complications such as aspiration pneumonia:

elements.name: TreatmentFactorsRisks
elements.title: Risks for {CmpnName} of surgical procedure with extended anesthesia:

elements.name: TreatmentFactorsRisksComplications
elements.title: Risks for {CmpnName} of post-op complications such as aspiration pneumonia:

elements.name: TreatmentFactorsAge
elements.title: {CmpnName}'s age:

elements.name: TreatmentFactorsGeneralHealth
elements.title: {CmpnName}'s overall health and prospects for quality of life moving forward:

elements.name: TreatmentFactorsCoexisting
elements.title: {CmpnName}'s coexisting conditions:

elements.name: TreatmentFactorsAccess
elements.title: Distance to or access to a qualified specialist:

elements.name: TreatmentFactorsOther
elements.title: What other factors influenced your decision whether or not to pursue surgery?

elements.name: ManagementHeading
elements.html: Medical managment of LP/GOLPP

elements.name: ManagementText
elements.html: Attempting to manage LP/GOLPP symptoms with medications is controversial. While no medication can restore movement to paralyzed laryneal tissue, many veterinary professionals believe some medications can have a positive effect on symptoms and improve an LP patient's quality of life.

elements.name: ManagementPrescriptions
elements.title: Did your primary veterinarian provide any prescription medications for {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP?

elements.name: ManagementPrescriptionType
elements.title: What prescription medications if any did your primary veterinarian prescribe or recommend for {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP?

elements.name: ManagementPrescriptionEffectiveness
elements.title: How effective were these prescription medications for {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP?
elements.description: 1 = not at all effective, 5 = very effective

elements.name: ManagementNonPrescription
elements.title: Not including over-the-counter (OTC) supplements, did your current primary veterinarian provide or recommend any non-prescription treatments or therapies for {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP?:

elements.name: ManagementNonPrescriptionType
elements.title: What non-prescription treatments (not including OTC supplements) did your current primary veterinarian recommend?

choices.text: Cold laser or red light therapy

elements.name: ManagementNonPrescriptionEffectiveness
elements.title: How effective were these treatments?
elements.description: 1 = not at all effective, 5 = very effective
